This is the third official visit of the Swiss President to Azerbaijan in the last 6 years. I also have an official visit to Switzerland.
This also shows that our relationships are at a high level.
Political relations between our countries are developing successfully.
The meeting of the joint economic commission in Bern, Switzerland-Azerbaijan business forum was held recently.
Thus, the business circles of our countries are interested in establishing cooperation.
Switzerland invests in the development of the industry, especially in the construction sector, and Azerbaijan invests in the energy sector.
I am convinced that in the coming years our joint ventures with our countries, possibly the region, ie third countries (cont) http://t.co/36qOyRA4mX
Azerbaijan is represented in the Swiss energy market, where it has a share.
Recent processes in the field of gas transportation will strengthen our bilateral relations.
At the end of last year, we signed a number of major projects, such as the Shah-Deniz-2, Trans-Anatolia and Trans-Adriatic Pipeline.
These are the largest infrastructure projects in Europe.
Nagorno-Karabakh is recognized by the international community as an integral part of Azerbaijan and (cont) http://t.co/UHa0trPe4y

Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan, which connects the Caspian Sea with the Mediterranean, is successfully operating today and serves other countries.
After the formation of the corridor, Azerbaijan began to play its transit role. Azerbaijan is a reliable transit country.
Investments in Azerbaijan's oil and gas industry, investment climate created by foreign investors (cont) http://t.co/tyLxdLoSGL
We always try to link the interests of producers, transit countries and consumers (cont) http://t.co/9dK6kGcSYr

These two factors can not be distinguished from each other.
Gas reserves at Shah Deniz, Umid, Absheron and other fields are at least 2.5 trillion cubic meters (cont) http://t.co/gbIPln8QFO
We have 7 oil and gas pipelines, which transports our energy resources in all directions. Of course (cont) http://t.co/DCR0JZ8GSd
TANAP and TAP projects will bring gas to Europe from a new source. This is not just a new route. (cont) http://t.co/5p86vi4OaH
Our funds are growing year after year. Transparency is our greatest priority.
If transparency was not provided, we would not be able to collect so much money.
Azerbaijan's participation in oil and gas sector and extractive industry transparency projects today (cont) http://t.co/i2LRjCeSVo

In #Ukraine I see four areas where our action should be continued and intensified #G7Brussels
Firstly, progress on constitutional reform, national dialogue and administrative capacity #Ukraine #G7Brussels
Secondly, stabilising #Ukraine economy & delivery of #EU comprehensive assistance package of EUR 11bn #G7Brussels
Thirdly, #Ukraine & #EU #energysecurity: Energy should not be used as a political weapon. #G7Brussels
Fourthly, coordination of intl support to #Ukraine. We stand ready to organise donors coordination meeting in #Brussels in July. #G7Brussels
I am proud of the contribution our #EU has made responding united & w/ determination & speed to the crisis in #Ukraine #G7Brussels
#EU is strong force for #democracy, #freedom, #prosperity and rule of law as shown in #Ukraine. #G7Brussels
